private_information: I am playing with a set of objects and I know the first statement and plan fragment.

Initial facts I see: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_5; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.

My plan fragment: sip object_9 object_0 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_5; sip object_11 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_9 object_0 object_7; paltry object_11 object_0 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; clip object_10 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7.
player.goal: Help produce a consistent representation of my observed initial facts and the provided plan fragment so it can be integrated into a single solvable planning problem.

private_information: I know a second statement variant and an alternate goal.

Initial facts I see in my variant: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_5; next object_11 object_5; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
The alternate goal to reach is: next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_7; next object_9 object_6.
I do not provide a full plan, I provide observed facts and a target goal variant.
observer.goal: Provide a clear extraction of my initial facts and goal and identify which plan steps from the player's fragment are applicable to my variant.

private_information: I am responsible for auditing temporal and causal consistency and removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.

Action model rules available: paltry preconditions hand X; cats Y; texture Z; vase X Y; next Y Z. paltry adds next X Z and deletes vase X Y. sip preconditions hand X; cats Y; texture Z; next X Z; next Y Z. sip adds vase X Y and deletes next X Z. clip preconditions hand X; sneeze Y; texture Z; next Y Z; next X Z. clip adds vase X Y and deletes next X Z. wretched preconditions sneeze X; texture Y; texture Z; stupendous W; next X Y; collect Y W; collect Z W. wretched adds next X Z and deletes next X Y. memory preconditions cats X; spring Y; spring Z; next X Y. memory adds next X Z and deletes next X Y. tightfisted preconditions hand X; sneeze Y; texture Z; next Y Z; vase X Y. tightfisted adds next X Z and deletes vase X Y.
I must remove bookkeeping shortcuts and normalize any tokens that resemble quota or penalty bookkeeping, and convert them into explicit causal dependencies or delete them if they are spurious.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that verifies causal chains, checks temporal ordering requirements, removes bookkeeping shortcuts, normalizes object references, and produces a cleaned causal model for the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate analyses and the audit report to produce a final PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problems formatted for the FastDownwards solver that solve the given goals.

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Each action has structured preconditions and effects that relate predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring.
Some actions add next relations and some delete vase or next relations according to the rules.
There are two observed statement variants with overlapping but not identical initial facts and different goal targets.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain observer who converts observed facts and a plan fragment into a structured analysis. Produce an object list, explicit initial facts, the intended goal, a step-by-step mapping of each plan step to action name and arguments, and indicate which preconditions of each step appear satisfied in the observed initial facts. Do not emit PDDL. Return a concise structured summary named analysis_player.
analysis.prompt: Agent player: use your private_information to extract objects, explicit initial facts, the goal associated with your statement, and map each plan step to its action and arguments. For each plan step indicate required preconditions and whether they are currently satisfied according to your initial facts. Produce the output as a structured analysis called analysis_player.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a secondary observer who converts an alternate observed fact set and goal into a structured analysis. Produce an object list, explicit initial facts, the alternate goal, and identify which of the player's plan steps appear applicable. Do not emit PDDL. Return a concise structured summary named analysis_observer.
analysis.prompt: Agent observer: extract objects, initial facts, and the alternate goal from your private_information. Compare the player's plan fragment and list which steps look applicable or inapplicable in your variant. Produce the output as analysis_observer.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency for planning problems. Your task is to take the structured analyses from other agents, detect and repair any temporal or causal inconsistencies, normalize object naming, and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties by converting them into explicit causal links or discarding them if they are spurious. Provide a cleaned causal model and an audit_report that lists any assumptions you made. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor: ingest analysis_player and analysis_observer. Verify causal chains and ordering, identify missing causal links, normalize any bookkeeping shorthand into explicit preconditions or effects, and produce a cleaned causal model and an audit_report detailing changes and assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert integrator and PDDL author tasked with producing a final PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files targeting the FastDownwards planner. Use the structured analyses and the audit report to construct a consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem instances that encode the initial facts, object declarations, action schemas, and the goals. Keep agent-level actions distinct if needed. Use explicit typed predicates where useful and ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The final output must be named pddl_orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator: integrate analysis_player, analysis_observer, and audit_report. Resolve naming inconsistencies and removed bookkeeping shortcuts as indicated by the audit_report. Produce a PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problems suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Label your output as pddl_orchestrator.
